name: looinv
body: |- wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), w1), wi(wi(w1, w0), w0))

stmt.origin: syl6(wi(wi(w0, w1), w1), wi(w1, w0), w0, wi(wi(w0, w1), w0))

body.origin:
|- wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), w1), wi(wi(w1, w0), w0))
-| wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), w1), wi(wi(w1, w0), wi(wi(w0, w1), w0)))
-| wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), w0), w0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), w1), wi(wi(w1, w0), w0))
-| wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), w1), wi(wi(w1, w0), wi(wi(w0, w1), w0)))
-| wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), w0), w0)

body.origin: |- wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), w1), wi(wi(w1, w0), wi(wi(w0, w1), w0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), w1), wi(wi(w1, w0), w0))
-| wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), w0), w0)
|- wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), w1), wi(wi(w1, w0), w0))

comment: The Inversion Axiom of the infinite-valued sentential logic (L-infinity) of Lukasiewicz. Using ~ dfor2 , we can see that this essentially expresses "disjunction commutes". Theorem *2.69 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 108. It is a special instance of the axiom "Roll", see ~ peirceroll . (Contributed by NM, 12-Aug-2004.)
